trans-unit.source: $RESOURCE_CONNECTED - Enumerate currently connected resources

target.mrk: $RESOURCE_CONNECTED - Enumerate currently connected resources

trans-unit.source: $RESOURCE_GLOBALNET - Enumerate all resources on the network

trans-unit.source: $RESOURCE_REMEMBERED - Enumerate remembered connections

trans-unit.source: Set of bit flags identifying the type of resource:

trans-unit.source: Display options for the network object in a network browsing user interface:

trans-unit.source: $RESOURCEDISPLAYTYPE_DOMAIN - The object should be displayed as a domain

trans-unit.source: $RESOURCEDISPLAYTYPE_GENERIC - The method used to display the object does not matter

target.mrk: $RESOURCEDISPLAYTYPE_GENERIC - The method used to display the object does not matter

trans-unit.source: Set of bit flags describing how the resource can be used. Note that this member can be specified only if the Scope member is equal to $RESOURCE_GLOBALNET. This member can be one of the following values:

seg-source.mrk: Set of bit flags describing how the resource can be used.
Note that this member can be specified only if the Scope member is equal to $RESOURCE_GLOBALNET.
This member can be one of the following values:

target.mrk: Set of bit flags describing how the resource can be used.
Note that this member can be specified only if the Scope member is equal to $RESOURCE_GLOBALNET.
This member can be one of the following values:

trans-unit.source: $RESOURCEUSAGE_CONNECTABLE - The resource is a connectable resource; the name pointed to by RemoteName can be passed to the _WinNet_AddConnection() function to make a network connection.

seg-source.mrk: $RESOURCEUSAGE_CONNECTABLE - The resource is a connectable resource; the name pointed to by RemoteName can be passed to the _WinNet_AddConnection() function to make a network connection.

target.mrk: $RESOURCEUSAGE_CONNECTABLE - The resource is a connectable resource; the name pointed to by RemoteName can be passed to the _WinNet_AddConnection() function to make a network connection.

trans-unit.source: $RESOURCEUSAGE_CONTAINER - The resource is a container resource; the name pointed to by RemoteName can be passed to the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function to enumerate the resources in the container.

seg-source.mrk: $RESOURCEUSAGE_CONTAINER - The resource is a container resource; the name pointed to by RemoteName can be passed to the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function to enumerate the resources in the container.

target.mrk: $RESOURCEUSAGE_CONTAINER - The resource is a container resource; the name pointed to by RemoteName can be passed to the _WinNet_OpenEnum() function to enumerate the resources in the container.

trans-unit.source: If the Scope member is equal to $RESOURCE_CONNECTED or $RESOURCE_REMEMBERED, this member is a pointer to a null terminated character string that specifies the name of a local device.

seg-source.mrk: If the Scope member is equal to $RESOURCE_CONNECTED or $RESOURCE_REMEMBERED, this member is a pointer to a null terminated character string that specifies the name of a local device.

target.mrk: If the Scope member is equal to $RESOURCE_CONNECTED or $RESOURCE_REMEMBERED, this member is a pointer to a null terminated character string that specifies the name of a local device.

trans-unit.source: This member is 0 if the connection does not use a device.

seg-source.mrk: This member is 0 if the connection does not use a device.

target.mrk: This member is 0 if the connection does not use a device.

trans-unit.source: If the entry is a network resource, this member is a pointer to a null terminated string that specifies the remote network name. If the entry is a current or persistent connection, RemoteName points to the network name associated with the name pointed to by the LocalName member.

seg-source.mrk: If the entry is a network resource, this member is a pointer to a null terminated string that specifies the remote network name.
If the entry is a current or persistent connection, RemoteName points to the network name associated with the name pointed to by the LocalName member.

target.mrk: If the entry is a network resource, this member is a pointer to a null terminated string that specifies the remote network name.
If the entry is a current or persistent connection, RemoteName points to the network name associated with the name pointed to by the LocalName member.

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains a comment supplied by the network provider

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains a comment supplied by the network provider

target.mrk: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains a comment supplied by the network provider

trans-unit.source: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the provider that owns the resource. This member can be NULL if the provider name is unknown. To retrieve the provider name, you can call the _WinNet_GetProviderName() function.

seg-source.mrk: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the provider that owns the resource.
This member can be NULL if the provider name is unknown.
To retrieve the provider name, you can call the _WinNet_GetProviderName() function.

target.mrk: Pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the provider that owns the resource.
This member can be NULL if the provider name is unknown.
To retrieve the provider name, you can call the _WinNet_GetProviderName() function.
